heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (188°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 11.5°C) and outside temperature (down 9.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 12%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 13694 lux) and cloud levels (up 1157 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13024 lux) and cloud levels (up 1062 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1157.2m lower than yesterday, 535.4m lower than the past week, 1061.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 928m minimum and 5160m maximum, with an average of 1377.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1912.4m and 2440m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Changeable conditions.
